title: Cannot Send Emails
content:
Hello, Thank you for helping me out today. For some reason I cannot send emails anymore. I have been tinkering around with the outgoing server settings for a few hours and cannot seem to be able to figure this one out. I am getting the following error message. Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.charter.net timed out. Try again.

This is the way my outgoing server is set up. smtp server DESCRIPTION; SPECTRUM SERVER NAME; SMTP.CHARTER.NET PORT; 587 SECURITY AND AUTHENTICATION CONNECTION SECURITY; SSL/TLS AUNTHENTICATION METHOD; NO AUTHENTICATION USER NAME; IS MYEMAIL ADDRESS

If you have any suggestions that you can share with me I would greatly appreciate it.

Thanks and have a great day.. :)
creator: AristotleNewton

title: Image attachments issue
content:
I am new to TB. Using 102.12.0 (64-bit), Windows 11, and I am migrating from AOL Mail Browser (Firefox) using IMAP.

So far, only one site has issues with their inline PNG image attachments, which display in AOL and IONOS Webmail without issue.

My TB current settings:

In SETTINGS > GENERAL > CONFIG EDITOR > are the following settings: mail.inline_attachments = true mail.inline_attachments.text = true

In SETTINGS > PRIVACY * SECURITY > WEB CONTENT > ACCEPT COOKIES FROM SITES > EXCEPTIONS > ADDRESS OF WEBSITE > http://cigna.com > ALLOW

In EMAIL > MENU (the hamburger in the upper right) > VIEW > DISPLAY ATTACHMENTS INLINE is selected

Attached is a COMBINED screen capture from TB and AOL Mail Browser and IONOS Webmail; latter combined since they display the desired end result.

What steps do I need to get TB to display like AOL Mail Browser and IONOS Webmail?

Thanks in advance for your assistance.
creator: hutch10

title: Forward CC filter
content:
Is there any way to make a filter that forwards to an e-mail address and CC to another? There's no option in the filter menu, and if make two rules on the same filter to redirect to two different emails, they won't know that each received the e-mail, hence the CC requirement.

thank you in advance

title: Perfil / perfiles borrado accidental
content: Hola. Manejo Thunderbird Mail desde 2006 y en MACOS desde 2009, como conservo mucho el correo tengo dividido en perfiles. Hace unos días decidí eliminar uno de los perfiles y ocurrió que se borraron todos los perfiles todo el contenido de la carpeta desapareció, con una APP de recuperación pude ver que los archivos XXXXX.default seguían en su sitio, por razones de trabajo deje esta recuperación para mas tarde, pasados unos días los archivos ya no aparecen. 1… Están en el sistema y debo de buscar alguna aplicación de recuperación para salvarlos. 2…Ya se han eliminado directamente. 3…Están en otra carpeta diferente /User/Library/Thunderbird Sería bueno ver de que manera no pueda volver a ocurrir. Saludos Desde Barcelona / Catalunya / Europa

title: Filtering fails on specific filter, error dialog box is of no help, space seems to be the problem, random folder.
content:
I am running Windows 11 Home, TB version 102.12.0 64-bit.

Recurring problem on getting emails (POP3 only).

Randomly, at least once a week, I get an error pop-up stating the folder name and it can not be moved to it. Reason seemed to be space. I've got the specific Profile and folders on a 512GB SSD with over 100GB's free, so I know it isn't a space issue.

I discovered that if I Right Mouse Button on the folder, select Properties, and then select Run Repair (which is still gray, not highlighted) and close the Properties. I then run the specific filter that failed and I can see the mail moved from the Inbox, and no longer get the error?

Suspect a timing issue or something that might cause an interruption?

I've run SFC and DISM with no errors.

I've also uninstalled TB and reinstalled, but I did not change or delete the Profile or contents.

Once I thought maybe I had too many emails in a specific failing filter the error pointed to. I went to the folder and it had less that 100 mail in it, so I deleted some. Ran the filter and it still failed?

Suggestions?
creator: irvspa

title: Google calendar events
content: I'm subscribed to a google calendar. I can view the calendar using Thunderbird or using a web browser. When I add an event from Thunderbird, it appears on the web, but when I add an event on the web, it doesn't appear on Thunderbird, even after I manually "sync" the calendars. I've found a clunky workaround; if I unsubscribe from the google calendar, and then subscribe again, the added events are displayed in Thunderbird. Is there a simpler way to sync the calendars?

title: An email account I delete comes back again
content:
Hi. I have an old email account in Thunderbird that I no longer use. It is not my default account. I go to Tools / Account Settings, select the old account on the left hand side and use Account Actions to remove it. It then disappears from the left hand panel and all looks good.

BUT next time I start Thunderbird, it comes back again !

Does anyone have any tips for getting rid of it permenantly?

Many thanks, Alvin

title: Trying to add Google CardDAV directory of contact fails validation
content:
I tried to add as remote address book in Thunderbird a google account using CardDAV and providing the CardDAV URL, the Google username and the password and fails validation. From Log Viewer:

" 2023.07.03 14:22:01:991 : Validation module : Validating without discovery request on https://www.googleapis.com/carddav/v1/principals/directory@swiss-property.ch/lists/default/ … 2023.07.03 14:22:02:070 : Validation module : Impossible to parse the server response because of this line : { ^ 2023.07.03 14:22:03:015 : Validation module : debug mode : cardbookServerDiscoveryRequest : 1 2023.07.03 14:22:03:017 : Validation module : debug mode : cardbookServerDiscoveryResponse : 1 2023.07.03 14:22:03:018 : Validation module : debug mode : cardbookServerDiscoveryError : 1 2023.07.03 14:22:03:019 : Validation module : debug mode : cardbookServerValidation : [object Object] 2023.07.03 14:22:03:026 : Validation module : Discovering phase 1 request on https://www.googleapis.com/carddav/v1/principals/directory@swiss-property.ch/lists/default/ … 2023.07.03 14:22:03:078 : Validation module : Impossible to parse the server response because of this line : { ^ 2023.07.03 14:22:04:048 : Validation module : debug mode : cardbookServerDiscoveryRequest : 1 2023.07.03 14:22:04:051 : Validation module : debug mode : cardbookServerDiscoveryResponse : 1 2023.07.03 14:22:04:055 : Validation module : debug mode : cardbookServerDiscoveryError : 1 2023.07.03 14:22:04:056 : Validation module : debug mode : cardbookServerValidation : [object Object] 2023.07.03 14:22:04:066 : Validation module : Discovering phase 1 request on https://www.googleapis.com/carddav/v1/principals/directory@swiss-property.ch/lists/default/.well-known/carddav … 2023.07.03 14:22:04:099 : Validation module : Impossible to parse the server response because of this line : -----------^ 2023.07.03 14:22:05:077 : Validation module : debug mode : cardbookServerDiscoveryRequest : 1 2023.07.03 14:22:05:079 : Validation module : debug mode : cardbookServerDiscoveryResponse : 1 2023.07.03 14:22:05:080 : Validation module : debug mode : cardbookServerDiscoveryError : 1 2023.07.03 14:22:05:081 : Validation module : debug mode : cardbookServerValidation : [object Object] " I am using Thunderbird 102.12.0 (64-bit) on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS. Please note that I could do without problems exactly the same operation (exactly the same CardDAV URL, Google username and the password) about 2 months ago using a slightly older version of Thunderbird. Also just logging in in Google in Firefox with the username and the password of the remote address book works fine and I can see all the contacts. So this problem looks like a bug introduced very recently in Thunderbird that was not happening 2 months ago or so. This makes Thunderbird unusable for me, so until this is fixed I will switch back to Evolution. Please let me know when fixed or if you have another solution. Thanks.
creator: valentin.brasov

title: Empty Thunderbird Window
content:
I started Thunderbird (version 102.12.0 64-bit) on my PC tonight (Windows 11 Pro 22H2). What I see is an empty window. Well, not entirely empty; it shows the menu bar, some of the toolbar buttons, and lines for the different panes of the Thunderbird window. But, there's nothing inside any of them.

Also, many of the menu functions are disabled or grayed out. Two that aren't, are Tools > Settings and Tools > Account Settings, but clicking either of those does nothing. The three-line menu near the top-right also does nothing if I click on it.

See attached screenshot of what this is all about.

I've seen a few different solutions online. One is to delete the xulstore.json file in my Thunderbird profile directory. I did that (to be more precise, I renamed that file to xulstore.json.save). Didn't help.

I also saw mention of somehow moving a profile between two different computers, which I don't think has anything to do with this situation. I have no idea what to do with that suggestion.

I saw something about "about:profiles" which I have no idea how to pull up (I tried entering it into the bars at the top of the Thunderbird window and hitting Enter; nothing happened).

About the only thing that even attempts to work at all, is Help > Troubleshoot Mode, which I tried. And guess what; although it did restart Thunderbird in troubleshooting mode, that didn't help, either. Still the big empty window with 99% of functionality gone.

I don't see an item in Help menu called "Troubleshooting Information," but I do see "More Troubleshooting Information." Clicking on that also (guess what?) does nothing.

Thunderbird's entry in Control Panel > Programs and Features doesn't offer any "repair" option, so that's yet another dead end.

Any ideas appreciated. But offhand it sure looks as though I'm SOL with Thunderbird. Guess I'll have to find a new email client, one that will actually, like, work.
creator: djhalnon
